TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit NavigationTerm extends Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTermSetItem
Public MustInherit Class NavigationTerm Inherits NavigationTermSetItem

Docs.summary: Specifies navigation behavior and properties for a object that is used to drive the navigation and friendly URLs for a website.

remarks.para: This class is analogous to the Term class in the namespace.

The NavigationTerm class adds properties and operations that are specific to managed navigation. The additional state is stored in the property and should only be accessed via classes in the namespace. A object belongs to a object.

The NavigationTerm and objects have two modes: an “editable” mode and a “read-only” mode. NavigationTerm objects are stored in the taxonomy navigation cache, which can be accessed by using functions in the static class.

example.para: The following example demonstrates creating a sample term set and then configuring a SharePoint Server web site to use managed navigation with the sample term set.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string AssociatedFolderUrl { get; set; }
Public MustOverride Property AssociatedFolderUrl As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ AssociatedFolderUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL value that is used to associate some page URLs with this object to indicate the location of the properties in the site map provider hierarchy.
Docs.value: The URL for an associated folder.

remarks.para: This property is used to help calculate the CurrentNode property for a SiteMapProvider. The current node indicates the location of the page in the navigation hierarchy, such, as displayed by a breadcrumb control "Investor Relations News Press Releases". Typically the current node is determined by searching the navigation hierarchy to find a node whose link matches the URL of the page being viewed, such as “/Pages/PressReleases/January2010.aspx". If a current node cannot be found (for example, the January2010.aspx page is not linked by any navigation node), then the breadcrumb would be empty. This problem can be solved by assigning the containing folder "/Pages/PressReleases" to the AssociatedFolderUrl property of the "Press Releases" term; the breadcrumb will now show "Investor Relations News Press Releases" for any page in that folder unless the page is explicitly linked by a navigation node.

The URL must be server-relative and may contain tokens such as ~site/ (representing the server-relative URL for the associated object) or ~sitecollection/ (representing the server-relative URL for the associated object). These tokens are expanded by methods such as .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CatalogTargetUrl As CustomizableString

Docs.summary: Gets the target URL that is used when rewriting URLs for catalog-friendly URLs that are based on this object.
Docs.value: A customized string that represents the target URL that is used when rewriting URLs for catalog-friendly URLs that are based on this NavigationTerm object.

remarks.para: Normally, the web server performs URL rewriting to render the friendly URL for a NavigationTerm by using the page that is specified by the TargetUrl property. For example, for the term "Cameras", the URLs might look like this: Friendly URL: http://example.com/products/camerasTarget URL: /store/Pages/TopicTemplate.aspxHowever, if a catalog-friendly URL suffix is appended, then the CatalogTargetUrl property will be used instead. Continuing the example involving the term "Cameras":Catalog Friendly URL: http://example.com/products/cameras/nice-pix-35mm/sku12345URL Suffix: nice-pix-35mm/sku12345 Catalog Target URL: /store/Pages/CatalogItemTemplate.aspx

Typically, catalog-friendly URLs are used for products such as the hypothetical "Nice Pix 35mm camera" in the preceding example, which do not have a corresponding navigation term, but belong to the category represented by that term. However, the interpretation of the catalog-friendly URL suffix is left to the controls on the target page, and other usage scenarios are possible.If the CatalogTargetUrl value is an empty string, then URL rewriting will not be performed for the term and the catalog-friendly URL may produce an HTTP 404 error. The target URL may contain tokens such as ~site/ (representing the server-relative URL for the associated object) or ~sitecollection/ (representing the server-relative URL for the associated object). These tokens are expanded by methods such as .
This property is only used when the LinkType is NavigationLinkType.FriendlyUrl. For other link types, attempting to change it will cause an to be thrown.
This property is a CustomizableString object. The default value is inherited from the CatalogTargetUrlForChildTerms.Value property of the parent or the NavigationTermSet if there is no parent term.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string CategoryImageUrl { get; set; }
Public MustOverride Property CategoryImageUrl As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ CategoryImageUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the specified URL of an image that optionally can be displayed by a template page.
Docs.value: The URL must be in server-relative or absolute format.The specified URL of an image that can be displayed by the template page.

remarks.para: Tip: This property is used with pages that act as templates by having multiple associated friendly URLs. The specific usage of the image property is determined by the controls of the target page.
The property is only used when the link type is . For other link types, attempting to change this property will cause a error to be thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete() cil managed

Docs.summary: Deletes this object and its child objects from the associated object.

remarks.para: This method performs an operation analogous to .
This method is only supported in “read-only” mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ExcludeFromCurrentNavigation { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether this navigation term and its child terms are hidden from the current navigation menu.
Docs.value: true if this object and its child terms are hidden from the current navigation menu; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: The current navigation menu, also called the “left nav”, is the contextual navigation pane that typically appears on the left side of the page.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ExcludeFromGlobalNavigation { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the navigation term and its child terms are hidden from the global navigation menu.
Docs.value: true if this object and its child terms are hidden from the global navigation menu; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Global navigation—sometimes called the “top navigation”—is the unchanging menu bar along the top of the page.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FriendlyUrlSegment As CustomizableString

Docs.summary: Gets a custom friendly URL segment for the node that is represented by the object.
Docs.value: A custom friendly URL segment for the node that is represented by the NavigationTerm object.

remarks.para: This property is a CustomizableString object. The default value is generated from the property by an algorithm that removes reserved characters (as described in RFC3986) and other characters that are undesirable for Search Engine Optimization (SEO) purposes.
This property is used with both the and the . For a simple link node, this property is used indirectly to specify URLs for child nodes of type FriendlyUrl.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm GetAsResolvedByView(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Term term, class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTermSetView view) cil managed

Docs.param: The object for which to create a related object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a object in editable mode that is bound to the specified object.

remarks.para: The NavigationTerm properties are resolved relative to the specified view.

The method is intended to support the editing of objects that are not actually being used yet by an . If the SPWeb settings are already configured, a better approach is to use the method or the property to obtain an object, with a verified view and then to call if you need to make changes.

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Navigation.NavigationTerm GetAsResolvedByWeb(class Microsoft.SharePoint.Taxonomy.Term term, class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web, string siteMapProviderName) cil managed

public: static Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Navigation::NavigationTerm ^ GetAsResolvedByWeb(Microsoft::SharePoint::Taxonomy::Term ^ term, Microsoft::SharePoint::SPWeb ^ web, System::String ^ siteMapProviderName);

Docs.param: The Term for which to instantiate a NavigationTerm object.
Docs.summary: Constructs an editable object that is bound to a specified object.

remarks.para: The NavigationTerm properties are resolved as if the object is being used by the specified object and the parameter.

The method is intended to support the editing of TermSet objects that are not actually being used yet by an SPWeb object. If the SPWeb object’s settings are already configured, use the method or the property to obtain an object with a verified view, and then call the method if you need to make changes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetResolvedAssociatedFolderUrl() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the AssociatedFolderUrl property as a server-relative URL.
Docs.returns: A server-relative URL for AssociatedFolderUrl; otherwise, an empty string.

remarks.para: This method never returns a null string.
The method applies the property to calculate a resolved server-relative URL from the property by expanding prefix tokens such as ~site/ or ~sitecollection/.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetResolvedTargetUrl (string browserQueryString, string[] remainingUrlSegments);
.method public hidebysig instance string GetResolvedTargetUrl(string browserQueryString, string[] remainingUrlSegments) cil managed
Public Function GetResolvedTargetUrl (browserQueryString As String, remainingUrlSegments As String()) As String
public: System::String ^ GetResolvedTargetUrl(System::String ^ browserQueryString, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ remainingUrlSegments);

Docs.param: Optional query string to merge with the query string part of the resulting URL. If it is not null or if it is not an empty string, it must be prefixed with the ? character.
Optional. Additional context for a catalog-friendly URL that is typically obtained from the method.
Docs.summary: Returns a target page address as a server-relative URL from the property.
Docs.returns: A server-relative URL or an empty string.

remarks.para: The method applies the property to calculate a resolved server-relative URL from the property. If the parameter is provided, the property is used instead of TargetUrl.
The returned URL includes the query parameters for term-driven pages:
If there is no target URL, or if the object is not a , then the return value is the empty string.
Note: To retrieve the resolved address for the link type , use the method instead.
The returned URL is resolved by expanding any prefix tokens such as ~site/ or ~sitecollection/ used with properties such as and .
Here are some examples of how input and output URLs might look for a root object whose URL is /sites/site1.
Note: In this example, the “Sort=ByTitle” is a parameter that has been passed through to the target URL by sing the parameter.
Friendly URL: /sites/site1/products/shoes?Sort=ByTitleTarget URL: /sites/site1/Pages/Shoes.aspx?TermStoreId=<value>&TermSetId=<value>&TermId=<value>&Sort=ByTitle
Catalog URL: /sites/site1/products/shoes/sneakerTarget URL: /sites/site1/Pages/ShoesItem.aspx?TermStoreId=<value>&TermSetId=<value>&TermId=<value>&UrlSuffix=sneaker

Public Overridable Function GetResolvedTargetUrlWithoutQuery () As String

Docs.summary: Returns a target page address as a server-relative URL that does not include a query string.
Docs.returns: A server-related URL, or an empty string.

remarks.para: This method resembles the method except that the returned URL does not include the query string, and the property is not considered.
If there is no target URL, or if the property is not a , then the return value is an empty string.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsPinned As Boolean
public: property bool IsPinned { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Indicates whether a object is a pinned term.
Docs.value: true if the taxonomy term is a pinned term,; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: A term is “pinned” if it is in a subtree of other pinned terms, or if it is the root of the subtree.

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property IsPinnedRoot As Boolean
public: abstract property bool IsPinnedRoot { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the underlying object is the root of a subtree of pinned terms.
Docs.value: true if the taxonomy term is the root of subtree of pinned terms; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Corresponds to the property for the underlying object.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string SimpleLinkUrl { get; set; }
Public MustOverride Property SimpleLinkUrl As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ SimpleLinkUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the target URL if the navigation node represents a simple link.

remarks.para: This property is only used when the LinkType is NavigationLinkType.SimpleLink. For other link types, attempting to change it will cause an InvalidOperationException to be thrown. The default value is an empty string, which causes the node to appear in the navigation menu as a heading (i.e. there is no associated hyperlink).
The SimpleLinkUrl may be server-relative or absolute format. It also supports other URI schemes such as ftp://, as defined by the method.

This URL may contain tokens such as ~site/ (representing the server-relative URL for the associated object) or (representing the server-relative UR for the associated object). These tokens are expanded by methods such as the method orthe property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TargetUrl As CustomizableString

Docs.summary: Gets the URL of a publishing page that is used to render a friendly URL.
Docs.value: The URL for the object that is used to render a friendly URL.

remarks.para: This property is only supported when the LinkType is .NavigationLinkType.FriendlyUrl. Attempting to change the link type causes an to be thrown.
This property is a object, and the default value is inherited from the TargetUrlForChildTerms.Value property of the parent object or the NavigationTermSet object if there is no parent term.

The web server rewrites URLs to render the friendly URL for a navigation term by using the page that is specified by the TargetUrl property. For example, for the term "Cameras", the URLs might look like this: Friendly URL: http://example.com/products/cameras Target URL: /store/Pages/TopicTemplate.aspx

The target URL may contain tokens such as ~site/ ~site/ (representing the server-relative URL for the associated object) or ~sitecollection/ (representing the server-relative URL for the associated object). These tokens are expanded by methods such s and .
The NavigationTerm.TargetUrl property is only used when the link type is friendly URL.
